name: MongoDB (Docker)
description: Connect to MongoDB databases and Atlas clusters via Docker. Query collections, inspect schemas, manage indexes, and run aggregation pipelines in an isolated container.

inputs.label: MongoDB Connection String
inputs.description: MongoDB connection URI. Use host.docker.internal instead of localhost for local instances (e.g., mongodb://host.docker.internal:27017/mydb).

obtain.instructions:
1. For MongoDB Atlas: Go to your cluster > Connect > Drivers
2. Copy the connection string
3. For local MongoDB inside Docker: use mongodb://host.docker.internal:27017/mydb

inputs.label: Atlas API Client Secret
inputs.description: MongoDB Atlas Service Account client secret. Required when Atlas API Client ID is provided.

auth.instructions: Connection string provides database access. Atlas API credentials (optional) enable cluster management features.
